subject: Physical Fitness
title: Eugen Sandow: The First Bodybuilder
description: A 60-second lesson on Eugen Sandow: The First Bodybuilder.

hook.text: In the 1890s, a Prussian strongman posed on stage in a tiny loincloth. The audience gasped. Bodybuilding was born.

buildup.text: Eugen Sandow trained not just for strength but for aesthetics. He sculpted his physique like a Greek statue.

discovery.text: Sandow sold mail-order dumbbells, wrote fitness books, and toured the world. He was the first fitness celebrity.

twist.text: His physique by today's standards looks modest. Natural training limits are far below what modern drugs produce.

climax.text: The Mr. Olympia trophy â€” bodybuilding's highest prize â€” is a bronze statue of Sandow himself.

punchline.text: One man flexed on stage in 1893 and launched a billion-dollar fitness industry.

quiz.question: Why is Eugen Sandow considered the father of bodybuilding?
options: He was the first to train for aesthetics and stage display
He won the first Olympic weightlifting event
